DOC.brief_title: The Cycle Disturbances , OLigomenorrhea Amenorrhea ( COLA ) Study & Biobank
DOC.detailed_description: Population Women cycle disturbance refer outpatient clinic specialize cycle disturbances 1st 2nd line care provider diagnostic procedure . Inclusion criterion WHO I Hypogonadotropic hypoestrogenic status ( previously : `` hypothalamic amenorrhea '' ) 1 . Low normal serum follicle-stimulating hormone ( FSH ) concentration 2 . Low serum estradiol concentration WHO II 1 . Amenorrhea oligomenorrhea ( mean cycle > 35 day last 6 month ) 2 . Normal serum FSH concentration ( < 12 IU/L ) 3 . Absence cause cycle disturbance , include : normal prolactin concentration ( < 1.0 IU/L ) , normal thyroid stimulate hormone ( TSH ) concentration ( 0.2 - 4.2 milli-International unit /L ) , abnormalities ultrasonography . Within woman WHO II status , polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) diagnose least 2 follow criterion meet : 1 . Oligo-/anovulation 2 . Clinical and/ biochemical hyperandrogenism 3 . Polycystic ovary ultrasonography WHO III 1. primary ovarian insufficiency ( POI ) : define secondary amenorrhea age 40 year basal FSH > 40 IU/L . 2. incipient ovarian failure ( IOF ) : define normal-ovulatory cycle raise basal FSH > 12 IU/L age 40 year . 3. transient ovarian failure ( TOF ) : define irregular cycle raise basal FSH > 12 IU/L age 40 year . 4 . Poor ovarian response : define less 4 oocyte retrieve cancellation case absent follicle growth ovarian hyperstimulation 300 IU gonadotropin . 5 . Early menopause : menopause occur age 40 45 year . 6 . Hypergonadotropic primary amenorrhea : primary amenorrhea raise basal FSH > 12 IU/L . Controls For analysis comparison female control need , data collect exist population base cohort , EPIC cohort ( Julius Center ) , select woman include preconceptional cohort ( PC , derive Department Reproductive Medicine Gynaecology University Medical Center Utrecht ( UMCU ) , separate protocol preparation ) . Exclusion criterion - Age : young 18 yr . - Regularly cycle woman , exception woman elevate basal FSH concentration ( IOF case ) . Study parameter In order determine phenotype characteristic woman cycle disturbance , allow identification genetic factor associate cycle disturbance , follow parameter obtain . - Age - Ethnicity - Social economic status education - Intoxications : smoking habit ( previous current ) , use alcohol drug - Medication medication history - Mental health ( depression , stress anxiety ) - Cycle regularity : age menarche , use ( oral/intrauterine ) contraceptives , mean duration cycle , variation cycle duration . - Reproductive & obstetric history : parity , time pregnancy pregnancy outcome , subfertility ( include treatment ) - Medical history ( include previous gonadotoxic treatment ) - Family history diabetes mellitus , early menopause , cycle irregularity , subfertility , cardiovascular disease , endocrinological disease , congenital disorder - Basic physical examination : systolic diastolic blood pressure , height , weight ( BMI ) , waist circumference , hip circumference - Assessment hirsutism , acne , Tanner sexual development stage . - Ovarian reserve parameter : antral follicle count , ovarian volume , anti-m√ºllerian hormone ( AMH ) - luteinizing hormone ( LH ) , FSH , prolactin , TSH , estradiol concentration - Androgen level - Lipid spectrum , glucose , insulin , High sensitivity C-reactive protein - In POI specifically : bone density assess dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DEXA ) , karyotype , fragile X premutation screening , presence autoantibody ( thyroid , ovary , parietal cell adrenal gland ) . Participation COLA Biobank consist additional withdrawal two blood vial ( one DNA one serum sample ) obtain routine diagnostic procedure . Relatives index patient : When familial tendency WHO status suspect basis family history 1st 2nd degree relative , relative invite participation study .
